title: I'm a first year student at mathematical department. What book must I read? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want a book that describes the beauty of mathematics along with its history and a qualitative, analytical and non-trivial approach to some of the practical applications of mathematics that we see in everyday life, you should give Jordan Ellenberg's How not to be wrong: the power of mathematical thinking a try. For a detailed review of the book, read this answer Sagar Kharwadkar's answer to What are the best books every teenager should read? Happy Reading!!!
